data.title: AHC: The Governors of Predator
data.meta_description:
The 1987 film Predator had an all-star tough-guy cast forming the Special Forces team that ended up fighting the alien menace.

data.text:
The 1987 film Predator had an all-star tough-guy cast forming the Special Forces team that ended up fighting the alien menace.

Oddly, two of the actors who played members of this team, Arnold Schwarzenegger and Jesse Venture were elected as Governors of their respective states. Your challenge is to have the rest of the team be elected as governors as well. I suppose they could be elected to Congress or as President if that is how you want to play it.

The cast, your candidates: (pasted from Wikipedia)

Arnold Schwarzenegger as Major Alan "Dutch" Schaefer

Carl Weathers as Al Dillon, Dutch's Vietnam War buddy, now a CIA operative

Bill Duke as Master Sergeant Mac Eliot, Blain's friend and a machine gunner

Richard Chaves as Staff Sergeant Jorge "Poncho" Ramírez, an explosives expert

Jesse Ventura as Sgt. 1st Class Blain Cooper, heavy-gunner, uses a minigun dubbed "Ol' Painless"

Sonny Landham as Sgt. 1st Class Billy Sole, a tracker and scout

Shane Black as Sergeant Rick Hawkins, radio operator

The 1987 film Predator had an all-star tough-guy cast forming the Special Forces team that ended up fighting the alien menace.

Oddly, two of the actors who played members of this team, Arnold Schwarzenegger and Jesse Venture were elected as Governors of their respective states. Your challenge is to have the rest of the team be elected as governors as well. I suppose they could be elected to Congress or as President if that is how you want to play it.

The cast, your candidates: (pasted from Wikipedia)

Arnold Schwarzenegger as Major Alan "Dutch" Schaefer

Carl Weathers as Al Dillon, Dutch's Vietnam War buddy, now a CIA operative

Bill Duke as Master Sergeant Mac Eliot, Blain's friend and a machine gunner

Richard Chaves as Staff Sergeant Jorge "Poncho" Ramírez, an explosives expert

Jesse Ventura as Sgt. 1st Class Blain Cooper, heavy-gunner, uses a minigun dubbed "Ol' Painless"

Sonny Landham as Sgt. 1st Class Billy Sole, a tracker and scout

Shane Black as Sergeant Rick Hawkins, radio operator

Predator Movie Poster | eBay

Find many great new & used options and get the best deals for Predator Movie Poster at the best online prices at eBay! Free shipping for many products!

Not entirely sure where to start, so I'll start by giving home states.

Sonny Landham actually tried running for Governor of Kentucky.

Carl Weathers, I'm not sure why but I think his best chance would be in Louisiana where he grew up.

Richard Chaves similarly would probably do well in Florida.

Bill Duke, I'm going to suggest Massachusetts for him as it's where he went to college.

Shane Black, I'm going to suggest Pennsylvania which is again where he grew up.

As mentioned before, Sonny Landham did try to run for office in Kentucky a few times and may be the easiest to get elected. Maybe have him run for Governor of Kentucky earlier than he did, in 1995 where Paul Patton barely won the election. If Landham can avoid too many gaffes and take advantage of Republican discontent with Clinton, he may be able to squeak out a win there. Whether he wins re-election or not is probably up for debate, but he'd be elected.

Looking into Carl Weathers, I can't quite place his political views but he did seem to be for getting out the vote, etc. I think he could run either in Louisiana (in the 90s) or in California at some point and potentially do well. If LO, he may be limited to just being in the House though.

As for Bill Duke, Richard Chaves, and Shane Black? I'm.. not too sure.

Duke currently lives in California (according to Wikipedia) but is from New York, maybe for some reason or another he runs for Governor of NY in 2006 or 2010? He'd definitely be a longshot but could be an interesting timeline. I'm not sure when he moved to California, but he could also run for Governor there sometime. Again, House Seat is also possible, or maybe a Senate seat in either state.

Chaves is from Florida, and I'm not really sure what his politics would be. I guess maybe he could run as a Crist type independent (either for the GOP or the Dems) and win sometime in the 2000s though I don't know if he could win re-election unless he veers to the Right in the 2010s.

Black is from Pennsylvania but also lived in California. I have no idea his politics either, though my gut is saying that he may be more suitable for Pennsylvania, though of course could maybe get a House seat in Cali.

I'll be honest, most of my thoughts primarily are gut feelings outside of Landham and Weathers, who I think both have the best shots at actually being elected.
